title: 2 things i really want to know!
body:
1. How come Olaf's ultimate 'Ragnarok' has a Japanese character on it? Historically the Vikings never set foot in Japan, the events of Ragnarok have nothing to do with Japan or its culture, Olaf himself has nothing to do with Iona or Japan. Secondly the character in question means 'Power' but the events of Ragnarok have nothing to do with power, its essentially the end of the world as we know it where the gods and fallen warriors of ages past are killed by monsters. Now i know how well thought out champs are, we can see from the insight riot gives us after a new champ comes out. so there must be a valid reason, i just want to know what it is. I cant believe that someone at riot was just like: "hey lets put a Japanese character on his ult pic" and no one questioned it.

2. How come turret shots deal no damage to you if the turret itself dies while the bullet is mid flight?
by that logic, if i kill lux while her Q is mid flight it shouldn't hurt me, but it does... So why?

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

replies.body:
At Riot Games we don't give a fuck about logic.

We just do it.

who's to say the character isnt chinese. The base of japanese was stolen from china afterall

And the "Power" logic, is it gives OLAF power, immunity and damage is considered power

The character is the same in both languages, so you can call it whatever language you want, it literally doesn't matter, the character looks identical, i am just more familiar with Japan than with China so i used Japanese instead of Chinese to describe it.

And it was hardly 'Stolen' Japan was settled by the Chinese early in its history who brought with them their language and way of life and it evolved from there. Thats like saying the Americans 'stole' the english language, no, America was settled by many nations, predominately those from English speaking countries. English itself is a language comprised of 'stolen' words, the word Berserk comes from the Norse word Berserker (From which Olaf is also named) words like 'Die' 'Egg' 'Birth' also have Viking origin, even the word Wednesday comes from the god Odin. So Japanese is as much 'stolen' from China as english is 'stolen' from the Vikings.

He also loses Armour and Magic resist though, which could be seen as 'Weakness' Although it does fit with the Berserker theme (a warrior who went into a trance and jumped into battle with no regard for defence) I do understand the reasoning for Power (all ults are powerful)

but my query was less to do with the meaning of the Character, and more to do with why it was in Japanese, which is of absolutely no relation to Vikings whatsoever. I would have though a character from the Viking Runic alphabet would be more appropriate, i just wanted to know RIOT's reasoning behind it. Its like using an Egyptian hieroglyph on Zed's ult, it just doesn't make sense.

it actually means force in Chinese, its similar but not the same. And the translation of 力 into japanese would more likely be the strength translation not the power translation.

Maybe it is the chinese 力 Lì, and not the japanese 力 Chikara

'Force' in Japanese uses the same character as 'Force' in Chinese.
So wether it means power or force is irrelevant, it is the same character in both languages.

i have no prejudice to what language it is in, there is absolutely no way of knowing except by asking the rioter who put it there.
i just used Japanese because i am more familiar with it, that is all.

but for some reason you cant seem to acknowledge that it could be either language, there is a 50/50 chance that it is either language, so neither of us can argue one or the other. i don't know what personal vendetta you have, but it could be Japanese just as much as it could be Chinese, and unless a Rioter comments, thats just the way it is.

Also you're missing the point, it doesnt matter what language its in, the main qualm was why is there an Japanese/Chinese icon, on a Viking.
I think you don't understand that I said it **COULD** **ALSO** be chinese, im not saying it **is**

Um.. Yes, and i established that, in the first sentence of my post?

"The character is the same in both languages, **so you can call it whatever language you want**, it literally doesn't matter, the character looks identical, i am just more familiar with Japan than with China so i used Japanese instead of Chinese to describe it."

So why continue on talking about it?? i have already said in that sentence that it could be Japanese or Chinese, and i only used Japanese because i am more familiar with the language (e.g.. if you saw the word 'Baton' written down in a book would you read it as english or as french? its identical in both languages, but you would say 'english' because thats what you are more familiar with. Its no different here.)

i never said it couldn't couldn't be Chinese, and that was the first thing i established in reply to your post. So you're right, so perhaps its you who didn't understand.
They should have used a scandiwegian rune definitely.
lux ults kill her before kills you after hands up if this has happened
